item.title: Upcoming Historical Adventure Game is Now a PS5 Console Exclusive, Skipping Xbox
item.description:
PlayStation 5 players suddenly have a new console exclusive to look forward to, as the developer behind the upcoming indie title 1348 Ex Voto has announced that the Xbox version of the game has been canceled. While PS5 and PC players will still be able to play 1348 Ex Voto when it releases on March 12, 2026, Xbox players will have to experience the game on another platform.

1348 Ex Voto follows the story of Aeta, a young knight who sets out on a journey to save her beloved Bianca, who is played by Baldur's Gate 3 and Expedition 33 actor Jennifer English. Gameplay consists of third-person combat based on European martial arts and utilizes multiple combat stances and combos for battle. Despite the brutality of 1348 Ex Voto 's Medieval Italy setting, there are elements of grandeur and beauty mixed into the game's world that make exploration a key part of its gameplay.

Italian Indie Game 1348 Ex Voto Cancels Xbox Version, Releasing Only on PS5 and PC

As the debut title from Italian indie studio Sedleo, 1348 Ex Voto has the chance to make a splash in the historical narrative adventure genre that has seen some fantastic entries in the past year. Games like Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 and Ghost of Yotei showcase what AAA developers are capable of producing in this genre, and 1348 EX Voto looks like a cross between the two, albeit with an indie tinge. Sedleo's statement on the canceled Xbox version explains the reasoning behind the decision, citing the desire to create the "best possible experience for PlayStation and PC."

While it's not exactly clear why PlayStation and PC were chosen over Xbox as the main focus for 1348 Ex Voto 's development, there have been third-party titles in the past few years that have struggled with Xbox releases. Baldur's Gate 3 is a notable example, initially launching on PS5 and PC before coming to Xbox several months later, after it achieved massive success on those other platforms. Part of this delay was due to the struggle Larian had getting Baldur's Gate 3 's split-screen co-op to run on the Xbox Series S, which the game launched on the platform without.

In contrast to Baldur's Gate 3 , 1348 Ex Voto is a single-player game, so there is no need for co-op consideration on the Xbox Series X/S. However, developer Sedleo is a much smaller studio than Baldur's Gate 3 's Larian, so any hiccups with development for Xbox might be more difficult to overcome while keeping the game on track for its intended launch date. Even with the cancellation of the Xbox version, 1348 Ex Voto is still on schedule to release on March 12 for PS5 and PC.

Xbox players hoping to check out 1348 Ex Voto may be disappointed by this announcement, but there is still a lot to look forward to on the platform in 2026. The recent Xbox Developer Direct 2026 showcased two exciting new single-player narrative adventure games for players to look forward to in the coming year. Pokemon developer Game Freak is releasing its post-apocalyptic game Beast of Reincarnation , while the legendary fantasy RPG series Fable is finally releasing this year as well.

On the other hand, 1438 Ex Voto will feel right at home as a PlayStation 5 console exclusive. The PS5 is already home to several exclusive historical adventure titles, such as Ghost of Tsushima and Ghost of Yotei , as well as story-driven single-player action games like The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered and Death Stranding 2: On the Beach . Adding some indie representation to this catalog with 1348 Ex Voto will only bolster the PS5's fantastic single-player library.

1348 Ex Voto

item.title: Some Hasbro Shareholders Are Suing the Company
item.description:
Some Hasbro shareholders are suing the company over its "mismanagement" of the Magic: the Gathering brand, taking issue with recent decisions made for the beloved card game. Hasbro stands as one of the biggest juggernauts in the entertainment industry, having its hands in everything from video games and collectible card games to beloved television and toy franchises. Among the biggest of Hasbro's many properties is Magic: the Gathering , with the trading card game being one of the most recognizable and beloved TCGs in the world. However, some fans have taken issue with Hasbro's recent management of the game.

Magic: the Gathering has seen some big changes throughout the past few years. Crossovers have become a mainstay of Magic: the Gathering 's product lineup, expanding from limited releases to full-blown expansions based on franchises like Final Fantasy and Spider-Man . Wizards of the Coast and Hasbro have also significantly ramped up the production cycle for the game in recent years, officially moving to release six Standard-legal sets per year and even planning seven full expansions to launch in 2026. Now, some Hasbro shareholders have finally had enough of Hasbro's modern management of the game.

Hasbro is Being Sued Over Magic: the Gathering

A new lawsuit filed by multiple Hasbro shareholders is suing the company for "mismanagement" of the Magic: the Gathering brand. Led by shareholders Joseph Crocono and Ultan McGlone, the lawsuit alleges that Hasbro has been printing too many Magic: the Gathering expansions, causing pre-existing sets to rapidly lose value. The lawsuit cites a massive increase in the number of sets within the past few years, citing not only full expansions but the plethora of Secret Lair drops from Magic: the Gathering . Among the many official claims listed within the Hasbro lawsuit are breaches of fiduciary duty, waste of corporate assets, and violations of the Exchange Act, alongside several others.

The rising number of Magic: the Gathering sets is not the only factor referenced within the lawsuit. One of Magic: the Gathering 's most controversial releases, the 30th Anniversary Edition special set, is cited as a major complaint, claiming that Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast had faked the product selling out. The lawsuit goes on to mention reports from former employees about Hasbro pausing sales of the set "less than an hour after its release," even stating that the unsold product had made its way to "Texas landfills." The 30th Anniversary Edition was the subject of significant controversy, both for its exorbitant $1,000 price tag and the taboo status of reprinting specific cards like Black Lotus.

Magic's Product Cycle Has Been Subject to Significant Criticism

The Magic: the Gathering -based lawsuit brought some major accusations about Hasbro's handling of Magic as well. One statement within the lawsuit references Hasbro using Magic as a "parachute" product, using new Magic releases to offset failures elsewhere in the company. Some expansions, like Secret Lairs and Magic: the Gathering 's Baldur's Gate crossover, were specifically named within the lawsuit, claiming "parachute sets" made up more than 40% of Magic: the Gathering 's releases in 2022. Hasbro has officially denied the claims made within the lawsuit, claiming the releases followed its "strategic plan" for Magic .

Magic: the Gathering looks to have a jam-packed year ahead with new sets releasing nearly every other month throughout 2026. January officially welcomed Magic 's first set of the year with a fan-favorite in-universe setting, launching Lorwyn Eclipsed as a return to Lorwyn and Shadowmoor. Wizards of the Coast has two more in-universe sets planned in Secrets of Strixhaven and Reality Fracture, alongside four crossover sets with TMNT , Marvel Super Heroes , The Hobbit , and Star Trek . The new Magic: the Gathering lawsuit could stand to be an early blemish on an otherwise big year for the beloved trading card game.

Magic: The Gathering Arena

item.title: Roblox: Ultimate Football Codes (January 2026)
item.description:
Football has always been popular in the gaming industry, with many fans enjoying their favorite game on the Roblox platform. The Ultimate Football developers have created a great game in which Roblox players have to try their best to win on the football field. To reward fans who enjoy the game, the developers also release Ultimate Football codes, all of which can be found below.

Updated January 25, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Ultimate Football has received several new codes that you can use to claim free rewards. These additions expand the current list and give you more chances to pick up useful items just by redeeming them. Rewards can vary, so its worth checking what each code grants before using it. Some codes may expire or stop working without notice, depending on updates. Make sure to return later to see if more codes are released.

Just like in many other Roblox games, the developers have added a huge number of codes, but most of them have already expired. Below is a list of all active codes, but they may also expire soon, so hurry up and get the rewards.

How to Redeem Codes in Ultimate Football

Similar to many Roblox games, the button to redeem codes can be found in the in-game menu. It is quite easy to find, and this is what players need to do:

  1. Open Roblox and launch Ultimate Football .
  2. Next, in the main menu, go to the Store tab.
  3. Go to the Redeem a Code section.
  4. Enter or paste the code in the Insert Code Here field and click on the tick. After that, the reward will be received.

Note that players who have just started playing the game will not be able to redeem codes. They must first spend 3 hours in Park Mode for this option to become available.

item.title: Rayman: 30th Anniversary Edition Just Leaked Online
item.description:
The next project from Ubisoft in the Rayman series has apparently leaked, as a potential game project has already received an age rating despite not officially being revealed by the company. The leak corroborated previous rumors about Ubisoft and its plans for Rayman 's 30th anniversary, despite the occasion already happening back in September 2025.

The news about Rayman 's return came amid a tumultuous time for Ubisoft. On January 21, Ubisoft announced a major shift in its operations and canceled multiple game projects that were in development. The biggest casualty of Ubisoft's restructuring was a highly-anticipated remake of Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time , which was stated to be near completion when the developer pulled the plug. Although it was not canceled by Ubisoft, a remake of Assassin's Creed 4: Black Flag was instead delayed. The fallout from Ubisoft's changes also had a negative impact on its bottom line. On January 22, Ubisoft's stock price fell to its lowest point in nearly 15 years.

Rayman Could Be Getting a 30th Anniversary Edition Game

Although rumors about Rayman 's return have been a persistent topic over the years, some new evidence could lend credence to the idea. According to a rating posted by the Australian Classification Board (ACB), a game titled Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition could be headed to the PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch consoles. The classification was dated January 22, 2026, just days after Ubisoft's controversial restructuring. Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition was rated G for General, with an additional tag that said the game could feature very mild degrees of violent content. The ACB's G rating is roughly the same as the ESRB's E for Everyone rating. The ACB's rating also lined up with those that past Rayman titles have received over the years. But, given that Ubisoft has not officially revealed any information about the Rayman series, rumors about a potential 30th anniversary game should be taken with a fine grain of salt.

Interestingly enough, the developer and publisher listed by the ACB was Atari rather than Ubisoft, with the rating application filed by U&I Entertainment. In short, Atari has worked with other companies on franchises that it doesn't own. For example, although the Mortal Kombat IP is owned by Warner Bros., Atari was listed as the publisher of the fighting game compilation Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection , with Digital Eclipse handling its development. As for U&I Entertainment, the company has worked with Atari and Ubisoft in releasing physical copies of various games. Ergo, the ACB rating could be for physical copies of Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition that may be distributed should the game make it to market. No other details about Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition could be gleaned from the ACB's post.

Rayman's Future Remains Shrouded in Speculation

The rating corroborated past reports from Insider Gaming's Tom Henderson, who stated that two Rayman game projects were in development under the code names 'Iceman' and 'Steambot.' Henderson later responded to questions about Rayman' s 30th anniversary project on X, and said that he believes that it is a single game rather than a trilogy. Previous rumors stated that 'Steambot' was the code name for a remake of Rayman Legends , a title known for having 1,000,000 collectible items. Ergo, the 'Iceman' code name is a likely guess for Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition . Henderson added that the game could be released "very, very soon" though it remains to be seen how soon that could be.

In the meantime, fans looking to play a Rayman game on a current-gen console are in luck. In December 2025, the Nintendo 64 app for Switch and Switch 2 received an update that included Rayman 2: The Great Escape as an exclusive perk for Switch Online users with the Expansion Pack upgrade. However, time will tell whether the rumors of Rayman 's potential comeback will be proven true.

9 /10

Rayman Legends

item.title: New Vampire Game on Steam Feels Like The Witcher 3 Fell in Love With Vampyr and Raised a Blood-Soaked RPG Baby
item.description:
The past decade has brought forth plenty of unique RPGs, but The Witcher 3 and Vampyr have managed to stand out with their fun gameplay and compelling worlds. The Witcher 3 is still incredibly popular, and Vampyr still maintains praise, even though it was a smaller-scale success. It's really hard to craft a strong RPG, but Steam hosts plenty of great indie takes on the genre. One of the newest RPG projects set to premiere on Steam is Kalyskah , and it promises plenty of choice-based gameplay and romance that is reminiscent of The Witcher 3 and Vampyr .

Although Kalyskah wears its Witcher 3 and Vampyr influences on its sleeve, it still aims at creating a world all its own. With a drama-filled story packed with game-changing choices and plenty of vampire-focused features, Kalyskah is an indie that both RPG lovers and vampire fanatics will want to keep on their radar. There are some solid vampire games on Steam, and Kalyskah is bound to be a welcome addition to that growing roster.

Confirmed Features for Kalyskah

  • Dynamic combat
  • Third-person
  • Open world
  • Character customization
  • Quests
  • Stealthy sneak attacks
  • Leveling and attribute system
  • Romance cutscenes

Kalyskah is a Game That Sinks its Teeth Into a World of Vampires and Political Intrigue

The game's playable protagonist is Kalyskah Karnstein. She's the very first vampire, which has made her ruler of the community for thousands of years. Some of the vampires in her ranks have grown tired of her reign, which leads to betrayal from those she thought she trusted. After waking up from a forced deep sleep, Kalyskah has to rebuild her following and find those who are against her rule. Kalyskah will meet a variety of different beings along the way to help bring her kingdom to the state it used to be in. From orcs to other vampires and even humans, all will play an important part in helping Kalyskah regain power again. Vampires in video games can make for some fun mechanics, and Kalyskah plans to continue that legacy.

Kalyskah currently doesn't have a set release date, but its Steam page confirms a Q1 2026 window.

Living As a Vampire Requires Plenty of Blood

Vampyr 's gameplay isn't purely stealth, but there are definitely stealthy moments throughout the story. Kalyskah is taking this to heart by featuring sneak attack gameplay to suck the blood of nearby victims. Growing Kalyskah's strength is one of the most important mechanics of the game, because it helps her level up to be as powerful of a vampire as possible. Right now, it's unclear if there will be any main bosses to take down in order to regain her rule, but Kalyskah's powers are confirmed to be used to fight against enemies like bandits, the undead, and various ghouls that stand in her way.

The Choices a Player Makes Not Only Affect Kalyskah's Fate, But the Fate of Humanity

In the game, humans are kept in the lower classes by vampires, but Kalyskah's choices can help improve their place in society. How Kalyskah treats both humans and other vampires is important, meaning that decision-making is an integral feature. The Witcher 3 's choices are still seen as some of the most impressive in the RPG genre. With Kalyskah still being in development, its version of these mechanics definitely aren't as expansive or refined as The Witcher 3 's, but it could help scratch that choice-making itch in a new way. Choices are also deeply critical in Vampyr , so it will be interesting to see how Kalyskah 's approach to these mechanics play out.

Save Humanity or Succumb to the Lust for Total Power?

Like any good RPG, players can decide what morals the protagonist has. Moral decisions in RPGs are one of the key ways to form one's character, and Kalyskah embraces player freedom. Players can work to be a leader who is known as benevolent and fair or someone who becomes corrupted by the need for complete control over both vampires and humans.

Vampires and Romance Go Hand-in-Hand

In pop culture, vampires have been depicted as seductive, and Kalyskah really dives into this. Those who loved The Witcher 3 's romance options will likely gravitate toward Kalyskah 's romance-heavy moments. From gameplay to cutscenes, the vampire RPG leans heavily into the more romantic qualities that have become associated with vampires over the years.

More Content is Planned for Kalyskah Before Its Launch

The game's developer, Nobre Lobo, is planning to expand Kalyskah 's world even more before the game is ready to be released. Features like quests, new characters, playable companions, castle customization, more rewards, and even a management system for Kalyskah's growing followers are hopefully going to come to fruition. Steam is one of the best platforms for indie devs to reach audiences and build a fan base. There are tons of indie games on Steam, and it can be difficult to stand out from the crowd. Kalyskah may still be a work in progress, but it has a premise that could quickly prove that it's a diamond in the rough.

The Witcher 3 raised the bar when it comes to RPG gameplay, and Vampyr 's Dr. Jonathan E. Reid introduced one of the best vampire protagonists in gaming. It's really hard to compete with two titles in the genre that are so well-done, but Kalyskah may be a solid indie take on both games' formulas. Whether one enjoys reveling in romance options and messing around with morality or simply just wants another game that focuses on living as a vampire, Kalyskah has potential. A game that blends Vampyr 's blood-sucking mechanics with The Witcher 3 's romance-focused features is a fun mix, and it will be interesting to see how Kalyskah stacks up against other vampire stories. The world of vampires is a fascinating rabbit hole to go down. Their lore and powers make them great for video games, especially RPGs. It's unclear when the game will be ready for a full-blown release, but in the meantime, curious gamers craving more vampire content can check out a free Kalyskah demo on Steam.
